name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  The cortex of a bone is the dense outer shell that provides strength to the bone; the spongy center of a bone is the cancellous portion.  The periosteum of the bone is the fibrous membrane covering of a bone that contains the blood vessels and nerves; the periosteum is similar to the capsule on a visceral organ.

**Note 2:**  The term "skip metastasis" is not used with a consistent meaning in the literature.  In some cases, it refers to discontinuous metastasis in the same bone as the primary tumor, while in other cases it refers to discontinuous metastasis in an adjacent bone, usually in the same limb.
rows:
Localized only

Invasive tumor confined to cortex of bone

Extension beyond cortex to periosteum (no break in periosteum)

Localized, NOS

Regional by direct extension only

Extension beyond periosteum to surrounding tissues:
    Adjacent bone/cartilage
    Adjacent skeletal muscle(s)

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
